posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Don't use a weapon at all. Fight unarmed without the Improved unarmed fight feat, so you provoke attacks of opportunity against you.
Unless I knew that I would get an item with Knockdown immunity, I would pick Skill focus Discipline. The modified rank of 43 is a bit on the low side. I would be looking for items with a Discipline bonus.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Thanks Mick, that's good to know.

Can you take a Skill Focus if yoy have no ranks in that skill ?  

I dont get my first Discipline dump until level 30. I could always cross class a few ranks if needed, I have an abundance of skill points.

Edit:  Does 3 ranks make that much difference ?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
You don't need any ranks in Discipline to take the Skill focus.
A strength based warrior that maxes Discipline will normally have a modified Discipline rank in the 50's.

A successful Discipline check allows the character to resist Knockdown. If I recall correctly, the DC is equal to the attacker's attack roll (1d20 + AB + size difference (+4 per size category)). To defend against Knockdown you roll an opposed check (1d20 + modified skill rank).
As your skill rank becomes higher than the attacker's AB, you will gradually tilt the outcome in your favor.
